info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, western Berkshire, northeastern Dutchess, Columbia and Rensselaer Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1042 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from Green Island to near Wingdale. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Troy, Pittsfield, Torrington, East Greenbush, Great Barrington, Hudson, Hoosick Falls, Chatham, Nassau, Claverack, Lee, Lenox, Amenia, Copake, Sheffield, Kent, Stephentown, Sharon, Pine Plains and New Lebanon. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads.
